title: The Wake - Here Comes Everybody + Singles
description:
Sentimental, non-threatening synth-pop, but as dour as that sounds, it's actually very unlike anything else that came out during the era. In fact, this is one of my favorite albums to come out of the eighties, and the DIY vibe this one gives off (it's very rough around the edges at some points) only adds to the melancholy, romantic-life-in-shambles charm of it. Check it out.

The Wake - Here Comes Everybody + Singles [1985] 2002 Re-issue

Format: CD
Country: UK 
Released: 2002 
Genre: Rock  
Style: Shoegazer, Indie Rock  
Credits: Producer - John Leckie (tracks: 11-14) , Oz (3) (tracks: 1-10, 15+16)  
Notes: Tracks 1 to 8 released as the album Here Comes Everybody (FACT 130) in 1985. 
Tracks 9 and 15 released as 12" single (FAC 88) in 1984. 
Tracks 10 and 16 released as a 7" single (FAC 113) in 1985. 
Tracks 11 to 14 released as the 12" single Something No-one Else Could Bring (FAC 178) in 1987.
